ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned most of the basic grammatical structures and introductory vocabulary of French (present tense verbs, some past and future verb tenses; subject and object pronouns; use of the imperative; commonly heard and used phrases; vocabulary for describing places and people, actions and activities, numbers, time, relationships, hobbies, locations).
I came into this course with little knowledge of French beyond Bonjour, and now I feel comfortable that one day I will confidently speak it.
I gained a vast amount of knowledge when it comes to French vocabulary and grammar. I also learned the basics of writing and speaking in French.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is very heavy on grammar and structure, which is very helpful for learning how to say and write a lot of things very quickly. I feel like I have a lot of the tools and requisite knowledge needed to continue in my future French studies. This class does not involve a lot of speaking in the class setting, so while I can write and read very well for just an introductory course, I find listening and speaking still very difficult due to the limited amount of repetitions we get in such a fast-paced course.
This class is very intensive! The workload is pretty high which is great for learning the language, but can be overwhelming if you have other high-workload courses as well.

I thought the strengths were the immersion method we were taught with. I also found all the course materials extremely helpful. Another strength was the collaboration with my classmates. I can't think of any weaknesses.
The strength of this course was definitely professor Ngame. The videos alone would not have been enough instruction. He was an excellent teacher.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend the course to any student that is willing to put in the workload required from this course to learn French.

I would highly recommend this class as a great introduction to French. You dont have to speak the language at all or have taken any french classes before, which is great for those who are very literally just beginning french. This class will get you into shape in no time and soon you will be comfortable speaking rather basic french.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student looking to learn French. It was a great way to gain a foundation in the language and I really enjoyed it.
Absolutely. It definitely taught me french.
